kOUQI1jSbCewj7xluXrHMg.text: This spot just opened up in the Quad on 64th and Thomas. So it's right beside my office. Great device and the outdoor patio space was perfect for our large group. So excited to have this option so close by!

D8JqDyaqEaYNa5bOiw11og.text: Pitch was so tasty! Amanda took care of us and did a great job. She was very personable and had so much knowledge about the food and the concept. The arugula salad was so awesome. It was a great choice for a birthday lunch. Thanks guys!

iVaBpc1Xac66Vvvc9oUbsQ.text: Great opening night with Dean and his team at Pitch last night.  Excellent Tuscan white bean appetizer and meatball pizza, not to mention a strong selection of California and Italian reds.  Service with a smile and a great vibe made for an enjoyable evening.

Fr7cr8uhu_msWF_TB4p5hA.text: A great night at Pitch. Comfortable vibe, great staff with corresponding great service. Owner was friendly and communicative, offered a wine cellar tour. Don't miss the meatballs and house Malbec. Loved the lighting and outside views.  Overall great experience, we will be back!

6KWdQZl2qneB7BaXzUVF0w.text: We went here a few months ago for happy hour. The restaurant has a great dog-friendly patio and is within walking distance of our house so we figured this would be a great staple in our happy hour repertoire. The menu is also what I consider leaning towards the "foodie" sphere, so we were extra excited. The place crashed and burned hard. They don't have many beers on tap, and only 1 IPA on their entire menu. They cater to cocktails and wine. We started with the calamari; it was bad. I had a few pieces and stopped eating. My date found a piece of plastic bag literally fried into the breading of the calamari, suggesting their calamari comes in a frozen bag. When we mentioned this the manager(?) that came by, he didn't seem phased. We also ordered the arugula salad and the Mia pizza. The salad was good, although the more expensive ingredients (e.g., pear, gorgonzola) were sparse. The pizza was a disaster. I can honestly say it is the worse pizza I have ever had from a restaurant. It tasted like something that you'd buy in the Walmart freezer section AND it was almost $20. It is one thing to be a shitty hole-in-the-wall restaurant, but what pissed me off is that they pretend to be a "foodie" location. I walked out of there wishing I had ordered from Dominos, that is how bad it was. On the walk home we left the leftover pizza on the corner near the trash in case a homeless person came by. If you want good pizza go to La Grande Orange in Arcadia.

uvRnH8gMzmUdtNEf57CKhw.text: Nice patio but super turned off by the service. I made a comment about the potatoes in my dish being under cooked and my waitress gave me a weird look, said "ok"  and walked away. A simple acknowledgment or apology would had sufficed. Things like this make me not want to return to restaurants.

CgNX4o_1KeVOCVluTKCHkQ.text: First experience at Pitch was a great one for us! We decided to bring in the New Year with brunch at a new neighborhood restaurant, Pitch was the destination. Staff was super friendly and food was extra yummy. We each ordered the creme brulee french toast (servers recommendation.) Serving was on the smaller side, glad we ordered a side of bacon to accompany. Dining with a toddler can be challenging but we found the staff and atmosphere to be inviting. It was a huge plus that they had a nice courtyard for our little one to run off some energy.  Thank you Pitch for the great experience!

aqLUcqKRJFGXcWoEynPEuw.text: Came here with my dad a month or two after it first opened. Great history behind the restaurant with a very open feel. The service was great and the food was pretty good. Ordered a few appetizers and a couple pizza's. I'd recommend the pizza and to sit on the patio. I'd highly recommend for a off site work happy hour or going out in groups.

NImRSL3A_eNMQSuENLR2QA.text: We love coming here after our bike ride around the canals. Our server Cooper is top notch and makes us feel right at home. I am obsessed with their wings and gorgonzola sauce (I came back after 3 days because I was craving their wings.) Their pastas are rich in flavor and can be enough for two people. Their pizzas are also great and I like their Red Sangria. Give this place a try! They also have a good brunch menu.

CQqe8XK4UCE5A6_M25-yVg.text: We've had great experiences at Pitch! Their IPA on draft is amazing and their short ribs and ribeye were both amazing, as well! This is our neighborhood "go to" spot. Their staff is always friendly!

GOhdTHht1QjzfWaIdg_ATA.text: Food is awesome.... our waitress Machelle was equally as awesome..... they have a good artichoke app and we shared pizza and wine :)

jbkL_VQNvGuXPO9JQiUwvQ.text: I first came here thinking it was a bar. Nope, Food is great with big portions and the drinks are like most places that serve cocktails. Try the onion rings with honey. The staff was very friendly and nice. And great atmosphere with the music that is upbeat.

BV2ZmPQVBU5aFVCV1qCdkA.text: Great brunch!!!  Perfect portions with lots of flavor.  Service was outstanding.  Be sure to ask about the Wonder of the Weekend (WOW).

IXQB_PYyfP5765HSuxPpgQ.text: I'm so glad there is now a Pitch in Scottsdale!! Love their wine selection and the pizza is always on point (and the mac&cheese and burger- yum) Not to mention the staff and service is solid! Their specials are always unique and tasty and the ambiance is relaxing and classy! They have two locations in Omaha and when I lived there, it was our go-to spot...I would highly recommend!

MA-j_3383s1uGuAkI2_mqg.text: Love this upscale neighborhood pizza/wine bar.  They are always busy!  I have been several times and I always get great service and great food and drinks!

zofQvHYO_4VPaZy2tcSVaQ.text: Great service, atmosphere and very diverse (and delicious!) menu. Would highly recommend. I will definitely be back to Pitch again very soon.

cRG_66CJT5t-sMDXpozO4g.text: Stopped for a drink, cool set up and layout had the crab cake app very good. Pizza looked little over priced. I will return

MEcsjM2upB-ztOBzsImbuw.text: Tried hard to like this place because of the patio, but after 3 tries, we're giving up.   Terrible service and mediocre food.   The construction on Thomas Road makes it hard to get there, and it's not worth the trouble.  Much better choices are close--- the Vig (much better patio and great food), or Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers (40th & Indian School, or Old Town Scottsdale), or Chelsea's Kitchen (outstanding patio and outstanding food).

6NmpwNoPat8GyapiGauavA.text: My 1st Yelp review. This place is so delicious. The flavors are so unique and blend together so well. Try the Artichoke starter and the Bianco Verde Pizza.

uHF4nX2ECvmf4bJ1KnNREQ.text: My new favorite place! Everything about this place is awesome... actually BEYOND awesome.  I had the wedge salad with shrimp and it was fabulous.  My friends had a delicious mushroom burger and Turkey melt.  The presentation was great,  the customer service was unlike any I've experienced in a very long time.  Before leaving,  I asked who I thought was the manager,  who owned the restaurant and he said, "me, and a couple others".. as he proceeded to clear our dishes.  An owner actually out and about talking to customers and clearing dishes??? what the whaaat?  Amazing!

s2CQ3rtJ6x2NLukwU8QD6w.text: The breakfast sandwich is AMAZING!  The ham and bacon combo with the basil pesto aioli!!!  Try it!  You will love it!!!!  Pam

OCenldBQ1JL0u_E2fT0juQ.text: Great food, great service, great atmosphere.  The pizza is amazing and the appetizers are too. I love that they have an area outside to play while you wait.  The kids liked playing while we waited, but it wasn't for long despite how busy the restaurant was. The beet gnocchi appetizer is to die for. The Pims Cup is refreshing. The wild mushrooms on the pizza are breathtaking. The entrance is a little difficult to find but more than worth it to walk around a bit. Try it and fall in love with this excellent restaurant.

fqRqZxZHe4OMjAnsQ4mChw.text: My fav new go to brunch spot!! Just down the street fun decor and friendly staff!! Located in The Quad on thomas a new installment and is a great eatery by day for breakfast, lunch and wine bar or dinner at night! I recommend coming here and relaxing on the patio where it is pet friendly and enjoy a good Bloody Mary or cocktail. Some brunch choices i Love is the short rib breakfast burrito and creme brulee french toast. They also have seasonal tastes of the day one was the red velvet french toast which is to die for yummy!! Come check it out so it stays open!!!!!

W-YuLzt7afx30u8YpKTnHQ.text: I was excited to try this new restaurant as it is in walking distance from my home, and has a nice outdoor patio.  My first experience was just ok.  Our server was very inexperienced and very under-trained,  breakfast was ok.  coffee was good but they charged me 50 cents for milk they had put in the coffee!!!  that was a shock....however, .being so convenient,I decided to give it another try for lunch, and this time I brought  my family. on a whole the food is fresh and good. The problem occurs with the staff, the waitress and mostly the management.    My brother ordered a breakfast sandwich and asked if the meats (ham and bacon) could be substituted for avocado. and the croissant be substituted for wheat bread.  .   .  He  specifically said " if that couldn't be done he would choose something else".  the waitress said "no problem"   the orders arrived and  the sandwich was made on a Croissant. :(  He decided to just eat it.  Also,  the little side salad had no dressing on it at all.   he politely asked for some dressing.   When the bill arrived they CHARGED for the avocado as an add on, not substitution for the meats... and they also charged for the salad dressing!!!! , which they had forgotten to put on the salad to begin with... well, I'm a believer that people are reasonable. when we asked about these charges the waitress said, she was sorry but didnt have authority do anything about it. we requested to talk to  the manager, who then came over. and instead of apologizing and taking care of the errors  he was  ARGUMENATIVE, RUDE, SARCASTIC and SURLY.  He presented with the  WORST customer service I have experienced in my 38 years of living in Arizona.  There are many good venues, & great food choices in the phoenix/Scottsdale area.  I will definitely not be returning to Pitch and I'd encourage anyone in the Arcadia/Scottsdale area to spend your money at a place with friendly ,nice staff and management that want to build community and relationships. These people running Pitch don't have a clue of how to become part of a neighborhood, build a local brand, or even how to create a successful business in a closely knit , highly competitive market like ours. Take your inexperienced, brusque, curt and gruff staff back to Omaha......youre not the kind of business we want in our neighborhood.

FYH6w0WwM5VlZnYaw-3X_A.text: Went in for a couple drinks and bite and ended up staying almost all night! Great atmosphere, our server Taylor was very friendly, personable, and accessable. We never waited for any drinks, had a great time and I'm definitely looking forward to going back.

z1_cspoe2fkI0UCAfF7m0Q.text: Great location, the food is so-so though. Appetizer and wine selection is outstanding, but pizza and dessert was mediocre.

CUOxFf9oxm0fRImUXw4hNQ.text: We stopped in on a Sunday afternoon for a drink and some dinner.  What a great new place in an unexpected location.  Lively atmosphere, airy indoor/outdoor space, friendly staff and tasty food.  I enjoyed a Stella cidre and we shared an order of fries and a meatball pizza.  Definitely a great addition to that neighborhood!

8m0zRnqJhWG67g396-mFBg.text: Love it! Super friendly staff, awesome food, fabulous wine selection! One of my favorite "go to" spots in town! The Thai pizza is absolutely amazing!

eUD5fNphy_NptRZoXEeR1g.text: Great new addition to the area, fantastic menu, great patio, and good music! They ha e a fabulous happy hour as well!

Krd-vHHy0QAwqlQfY5rLtw.text: It's cute and new - the vibe is casual and hip. Plenty of parking without the annoyance of valet. Staff is attentive. Menu is big on pistachio but has something for everyone - open concept with plenty of seating. Ordered the Brussel sprouts which we loved!  The gnocchi was amazing! Served in cast iron to keep warm ... the dishes are all very large prepare for leftovers!

sSlxAWzHSP3D9xk8lHSjfA.text: Cooper is by far the best server around! She is wonderful even each time we come in, she remembers are name and gives us 5 star treatment. Also the food is amazing! Everything we have ordered here had been nothing but pure perfection. The wine is fabulous. The owners are so friendly and make sure you are taken care of.

FnQYxJzGiV2leCTvIbK63g.text: After reading all the rave reviews, we gave this place a try last weekend. The service was decent, atmosphere is great (except for being sat at the end of a large table with a big birthday party at the other end), cocktails and food were fine, but overall everything they do is already done better by someone else in the valley. Additionally, their prices are high in comparison to the quality of food and wine (by the glass) served.

n2-M0TtYNBGR_0RJp7IBRw.text: Atmosphere: Great Food: Good Employees: Great Service: A bit slow but sufficient Prices: High  I'm unsure whether this is common, but they don't provide wait times. I found this annoying because I was unsure whether our group of six would be waiting for 10 minutes or 60.   I recommend Pitch provide wait times to customers, even if they're grossly overestimated. Better to under-promise and under-deliver, right?  The prices will probably keep us away, but I still recommend it.

8-eU5aKF5VgTkcBRkjIdag.text: So good. Lobster Mac, Short Ribs, Good Morning MIA with Jalapenos, Creme Brulee French Toast, Truffle Fries, Brussels Sprouts, Scampi Rigatoni. MEATBALLS!! Buffalo Wings, those things rock my face off. Short Rib Burrito with Jalapeno Green Chile Gravy for brunch!! Yes. Creamy Beans. Crab Cakes. Salmon. Pizza and a bottle of wine for 30 bucks, are you kidding me!? Great service, accommodating and knowledgeable. Great Cocktails. Phenomenal liquor options. Best wine list in the Valley. Beer list should be sampled as well as the Scotch and Tequila selections. Check it out.

587EfMOhDmlA9YJze0Ss6w.text: I'll start with the good. The patio, atmosphere, and location off the canal earned 3 starts. We rode our bikes here on Friday night with a group of friends. The service was ok, slower, but expected being a new restaurant. Our server was young and messed up a few of the drinks but got the food orders correct and that came out quickly.   But man, the food and the prices wouldn't ever make me want to go back. I was blown away by the prices- $16 for a chicken Caesar salad that was Small and plain. And pizzas are 12" thin crust for $21! We got the doc as that was what she recommended and hated it. The ingredients didn't work and it had an odd spice. The calamari was big but not much seafood, rather a lot of battered zucchini and way too much breading. Overall we were disappointed. And for a few drinks and some food each couple spent around $75-$100. For beer, wine, and pizza. Not impressed. For this location they better get the prices down or I don't see this place making it.

R0U6TEwQ88Dfe-5FK4Laiw.text: I did like this new addition to valley dining. How cool is the fact they are a scratch kitchen. The food including the Brussels sprouts are absolute FIRE. I have a pizza and the coolest part they let me put some sous viid eggs on top. Definitely something I've never done before. My god it was worth it. The cocktails need a little shaking but once you stir them up they tasted decent. Just a procedural issue i wanted to share

gg85sMN6cfjfDS7itrIOng.text: Patio was open, dog friendly and cute! Looks like same decor as many new places in Arcadia and Oldtown. That modern look, but it is nice! We came in an hour before Super Bowl and it was dead. It was a cute concept. We had the meatball pizza and wings. They were both good! Prices were ehhh decentish? (except for the $25 crab cakes and a few other "specialty" pizzas). We will definitely be back with our pup and try more things on the menu. But if they want to survive I think their prices will need to come down a bit!

4sFt3_NgpZ0ZsLkJOGmwfQ.text: Atmosphere, staff and food are on point! The beet gnocchi is absolutely stunning! I seriously thought it was stuffed with cheese but it's just magical all on its own. Eaten here a handful of times and have never been disappointed. Impressed with every experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Drop the beet!

Is8vGEAEnfFn-KztF3ozkA.text: Been here a handful of times and it's always amazing! Such a big menu with variety. I always get something I've had and know I love and something new which I end up loving as well. Great atmosphere with good eclectic music playing.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Buffalo tempura cauliflower

YcmQD8DzfsGz3paqVOuTjQ.text: Once again the service was as bad as the last time. When will we ever learn? We want it to be a success so hopefully they will take it to heart.

_ZYLiiUlg99b-ovftIwHBg.text: Fout of us dropped in for afternoon drinks and we ended up being a table of eight. We sat outside on their beautiful patio. Metal structure intertwined with sails. We all enjoyed Happy Hour pricing on our drinks. What a nice surprise HH starts at 2pm here. The Cosmopolitan was excellent. My son in law had some different Mules and he enjoyed them. My son & wife enjoyed 50% off a bottle of wine. The food was very good also. The place became busy, when offices closed. We will definitely be back.

MWEkP4bdD_u0zzRWQrd4Jg.text: Great place. Great service. I had my daughters birthday party there  and service was 100% fantastic. Thank you Great time  great food.  Waiters and waitresses were so gracious.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shoutout to pitch and my wonderful servers for making this a great party. We drove them crazy in the beginning andthey were great

3e2yPHfT1NT6knARLA7Bew.text: Stopped in for a late lunch around 3pm on a Saturday. It was quiet and there was just one other table. Server was pretty laidback which was fine since we were in no rush.  On the weekend they serve brunch which we both partook in I had an open face egg sandwich with spinach and topped with a rich cheese sauce. Hubby enjoyed his chicken and waffles.  Overall the food was good and the ambiance is delightful for this lovely neighborhood place.  Next time we will have to try the pizza!  The yelp pictures have my mouth watering!

Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

GI4RTHJQzadyQEuDjAfUDA.text: My friend and I came here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. It wasn't busy at all and we were seated right away.   I ordered the Mia pizza. Mozzarella, sausage, pepperoni, tomato sauce. It was good, but I was bummed they didn't have ranch of course. We also ordered the truffle fries to start which were good. The pizza was a pretty large size, so good to share.   The food was good, I was bummed they didn't have ranch and our waitress should be trained to be more sociable. She seemed like she didn't want to talk or smile at all. I thought it would've been busier for a Saturday. They do have a big menu though and also offer, breakfast/brunch, and happy hour. They also have a pretty cute outdoor patio too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mia pizza

r1tg-kq2jiLZpjS51f1egw.text: Gets the bloody right! Has an awesome room you can rent for meetings too. Full catering in to the room, watch your limit they give you - you won't need as much more than likely. The service is amazing all day, food is awesome.   People are great- beat gnocchi is a must have!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody&#39;s done right!
Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Private meeting space

ys5YLMkZqWIZEzL4E2ywxw.text: Since moving to Scottsdale in December,  my husband and I have been obsessed with Pitch (not to mention it is a quarter mile from our house).  We have tried the bolognese, Mac and cheese, artichoke appetizer, onion rings, Thai chicken salad, short rib grilled cheese... all are stellar with no complaints.  Alcoholic drinks have a good pour so you get your money's worth.  I am a big fan of their extensive menu of Moscow Mules.  Service has been awesome every time outside of one particular waiter who seemed socially awkward, but he was nice nonetheless.   Excited to try the happy hour.  Definitely give this place a go.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

19SRGBff0ObphuO4vJbBKg.text: We started with Arnold Palmer, and Midtown Mary (Aka Bloody Mary). The topping for the Mary is tasty and creative. They put a tiny skewer, made of slide of sausage, goat cheese stuffed pepper dew, and pickled baby corn cover with spiced salt, on the drink. Both drinks are refreshing and good for Sunday brunch or hot summer.  Then we got half onion rings, and sweet & spicy rosemary wings. The onion ring batter is so delicious and not too fluffy light and not too soaky. When I dipped it with the sauce, sriracha mayo style, they go so well together. The wing plate has a nice high end design. They use the lettuce wedge with blue cheese, instead of the typical celery, carrot, ranch. The wings were juicy and the sweet & spicy rosemary sauce gave me a taste of Asian (sweet & spicy) with fresh herb (rosemary) kick. Delicious!  While waiting for the pizza, we got another round of Arnold Palmer and Midtown Mary. Then the meatball pie pizza has arrived. The meatball pie came right from the oven as we could we the steam coming out of the meatball. The meatball pie has a super thin crust and each slide has half of the big meatball on it. The fresh basil on top does enhance the favor of this delicious pie.  We were too full to get the desserts. Next time we need to plan better so we will have a chance to try the dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meatball pie

MCQyj1ieIiYdBwvjwEtMkA.text: This place is pitchin'!! I honestly thought it was a new up and coming coworking space or incubator for startups, just based on the name and location. I was pleasantly surprised by the awesome menu and drink offerings. Beautiful patio area and cool vibe. I enjoyed the charcuterie board and the artichoke starter - YUM! Service was great and I will absolutely be back soon. Wish I had known about this place sooner!

MDeXV04TrSClHNlArah_xA.text: Terribly disappointing...we had to ask for 1 dish to be redone and another was completely over salted. Very expensive for what is was. Only good points...nice decor and a lovely waitress.

GTWe0ZyrK7RO7ooFLcdFiQ.text: The pizza could've been more well done, but I suppose we could've asked for that. While our first pizza was slightly above average, the chicken pesto pizza was a huge disappointment. Drinks were extremely watered down with large ice cubes. Unfortunate - this place is very cute and I love the decor, just not the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-RGzdxwdpedz_qm0lUc06Q.text: I am here in AZ for a work trip, so a couple of my coworkers and I wanted to get a late dinner on a Friday night before one of them had to catch a flight. We got a table with no wait! We sat outside (even though it was really hot, they had nice misters so it was perfect). We told our waitress we were in a hurry, and we got our food SO QUICKLY, it was unbelievable how quick. And it tasted amazing. I definitely recommend the buffalo cauliflower wings, meatballs and crispy Brussel sprouts! Definitely recommend this place!

7OA2zyl_es2dZPAAkrVXlA.text: That Arugula salad with Prosciutto and Shrimp was killer. 100% will be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Arugula and Prosciutto Salad w. Shrimp.

ivkwGPJQOBRbZEzmsoVU2Q.text: Buffalo cauliflower was a ridiculous explosion of goodness in my mouth! And they have like seven varieties of Moscow mules! Everyone has mules but not that many varieties.  Perfect Scottsdale vibe. If you're from here you know what that means. If you're not, it means it's classy, eclectic, a little bit boujee, and a little bit pricey. If you want a place where you pay just a bit too much but you have a nice patio with green vines and cafe lighting to take a pic for your instagram, this is your spot my friend.

r4WW6-4a9RSFS2PBJeTAzw.text: Pitch is really close to where I live so I find myself driving by it several times a week and thinking how cute the patio looks. One day, I was driving by and I saw a sign saying they sever Press Coffee. It was a done deal then; I knew I would be trying Pitch.   Finally the perfect opportunity came along. The rock and roll marathon was going on and I found myself unable to drive in any useful direction. I need a brunch place stat, within walking distance. My mom and I walked over to Pitch.  My mom for some reason thought it was three miles away and still started walking. She was very pleasantly surprised!   We sat on the patio. I ordered a mocha, made with Press Coffee, of course. My mom opted for some beer for brunch! For food, I ordered the short rib breakfast burrito. I did not think the menu did a good job describing this item, because it was way better than I thought it was going to be. It was covered in a jalapeno sauce that was more like a soup around the plate. I love sauces so I was very excited about this. It was also served with some very yummy potatoes. The menu made it seem like the potatoes were in the burrito vs. served on the side. I was really glad they were on the side; I love breakfast potatoes.   My mom ordered the weekly wonder, which is a different special each week. When we went, it was chicken enchiladas and she loved them!

xjHpMlHu4cjL9WjIzv1Lgw.text: In love with this restaurant! So many yummy options. I went for the Cajun Caesar salad (half portion) with salmon $12, and it was delicious.. the salmon was cooked to perfection, and each addition to the salad enhanced it. Dont let the anchovy ingredient scare you away. Next time I'm back for lunch, I will likely order their half mixed greens and 2 meatball lunch special $10. They have yummy starters and sandwich options, but I'm most excited to come back for Happy Hour to order one of their pizzas. Their discounts on drinks is legit too- $7 Myles and $5 cocktails with a few food discounts. The oversized porch makes this the perfect date spot; a few TVs inside for sports also.

Rt_TqqD4RrGxmCpmX57qdw.text: This is a nice laidback place to eat for lunch. The menu is completely overpriced and the food is average.  I come here almost everyday with coworkers because we work right next to it.  The bartender absolutely nickels and dimes us constantly. Extra charge for dressing, doesn't explain items properly so that we order things that aren't on special (I.e. the $10 soup and salad that was actually $17 because she didn't correct my friend on the parameters), etc.  We are moving offices and looking forward to changing our daily lunch routine.   I like the setup and patio. Staff is nice.

rLaq49MKrOInPPnqfn4ybQ.text: I've been coming here since I started working in the plaza Pitch is attached to and I love that it's a 2 minute walk from my office.    The staff is always super friendly and the inside and patio are beautiful.  Large open seating areas and huge high top tables.  I've ordered quite a few items from the menu over the last few months and I can say that everything from here is pretty dang tasty.  The Chicken Po Boy's are one of my favorites, along with the meatball Hoagie and their classic flame grilled burger.    I've tried their mac and cheese once which was very good and comes in a cast iron skillet which keeps it hot the whole meal, however the price tag is a little much for a lunch item for me.  paying almost 20 dollars for pasta and cheese is a little much if you ask me.  Their pizza's are also around the 20 dollar range which normally keeps me away from those items as well.  I do love this place and it's a regular spot in my rotation of lunch places and being in the same parking lot as my work is an added bonus!

GrFSLPRiYfSVfoOONWtrig.text: After looking up this place I totally thought it was sports bar by its name, but nope.  It's excellent pizza & Italian place! Had incredible service and it good place to visit from being out of town!  -Very nice patio -Good Service  -Nice Prices

Db-4dxVTtTNtPII1FjPiJg.text: Everyone's raving about this place and I don't understand why. The food was decent but over priced and service was average. Overall it's over hyped over rated and over priced.

bvXx2RIF7Zo4y3JFTcIT6A.text: The environment was amazing. Service was great. I sat outside at the bar. The drinks were amazing. I definitely will be back soon.

zLsSh-LRuY82rXpPe5_cBg.text: Incredible experience! We were craving pizza so did a Yelp search and the pictures posted and location are what brought us in.  Was very welcoming staff, nice decor, great beer, and amazing food! We felt like regulars after the way the staff interacted with us even though it was our first time there. We will most definitely return! Thanks Pitch!  Big props to Megan and the rest of the bar staff for providing a great experience!

IY88X4dgwAXC59GvVu7vRw.text: Always falls short. Food. Service. Just below the mark.

QMioMwaGcCth6gn8usmFtQ.text: I enjoy the vibe of this place and their dog friendly patio! They don't have vegan options on the menu so we ordered a vegetarian pizza with no cheese, but it came out with a cream sauce. Our server was great and corrected it right away! Thanks lady!

u7XMlXHnNN6pVwlXRzt_zw.text: Came here for dinner and a few drinks.  Nice indoor and outdoor seating.  Couches outside with corn hole toss out on the grass.  They had a nice drink menu.  Their food menu had a nice range from  appetizers to dinner plates.  The food is your normal pub flavor.  Nothing out of the ordinary.  Great place to meet up after work as well a great place for large groups.

d6J-YJfWPvPHHH_2v2iTYw.text: This place has the most amazing mushroom pizza. It's a must-try. Definitely will be coming back very soon

D53kc_cPBiMjmvL5uSim0g.text: Had a great pizza and the onion rings were good.  Our server was really attentive also.   Unfortunately  our dessert was lackluster.  We had the berry cobbler which turned out to be a dish of warm blueberry pie filling with very little streusel and an even smaller scoop of ice cream.  Need to work on the desserts and portion size

sO1AUlUY9WAmpVofE6djzQ.text: Went here for the first time today after seeing the food pics on instagram, the food is better than the pics. Will try the pizza next time and definitely grab a big Miller high life  beer. Would totally recommend!

VWhBdusRWz5keR2vp9J1EA.text: I brought a group of 10 to this venue on a Wednesday night and the service was incredible. Everyone enjoyed the food, wine, and cocktails. I had the fried brussel sprouts and a couple glasses of sangria, which were both very good! Only one person in my group got a pizza. The special that night was the taco pie and highly recommended by our server, but it was not was not my favorite. The pizza crust was really good indicating their regular pizzas are probably worth trying on a second visit.  The venue is beautiful with a large outdoor patio perfect for our Arizona evenings.

vi5dnbSt0VpMn2yrATLrTg.text: A girlfriend chose this restaurant to have her birthday lunch. What a nice surprise! Pleasant decor, a lovely server and delicious lunch! It could not have been a better choice! They treated us very well and the menu has a lot of different choices! I was torn between the beet salad and the short rib grilled cheese! The grilled cheese was amazing! I had the side salad which had garbanzo beans and a sweet Italian dressing. My daughter had the truffle fries and we could not stop eating them! So tasty! We will return and sit outside in their great patio next time!

XLGno0YeaDPFt3wQfysnvQ.text: I cannot say enough about my experience there last night. I went on a lady date with a friend who travels for work so we needed a couple hours to hang out and catch up. Let's start with the staff, Brandon was our server/bartender and mainly helped us but literally the entire staff came by at some point (to deliver food, bring more water or pick up plates etc...) and they were all so friendly and looked like they enjoyed working there. We ordered the cauliflower in evoo, the Brussels with parmesan, goat cheese stuffed peppadews and the charcuterie board as well. All of it was great. The board had pickles, hummus, olives, nuts, meats (including duck prosciutto), cheeses and mustard. I mean, it was amazing. To top it off, Matt, the wine guy of this operation came over and we chatted about wine and he made an excellent selection for us. The wine list is fairly priced and on Sunday it's half priced bottles up til $90, then it's 25% off.  All that food and 3 bottles later and our bill was next to nothing. We had carrot cake to end the night and I seriously cannot wait to go back.

Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Incredible wine list at extremely fair prices.

xiEyswv2zmAUMJIn4n2xQQ.text: Stopped in for brunch today and was quite impressed. Our server Amanda was attentive and upbeat. Portions were large and food was very good. Will be stopping back to try the pizza.

7hMyMi_jkm3KyThCRoTrDQ.text: Very trendy ambiance, creative pizza ingredients, and dog friendly patio. My dog approves of the pasta as well. Delicious macaroni and cheese that will entice me to come back for more. Pizza slightly over priced but you get what you pay for and this has delicious written all over the menu.

OGqGtCe48J1jFkKOANHY8w.text: Came for a girls night dinner and was not disappointed. The pizza was PHENOMENAL and so was the overall experience! Our waitress was nice and had really great drink suggestions, the food came out promptly and the entire restaurant was just simply lovely all around. The location is just West of Scottsdale Road on Thomas, so its a lot quieter than your average Scottsdale restaurant (score!) There is an all-glass wine cellar near the entrance which gets your mouth watering right when you step inside. Hanging all around are the gold Edison style light bulbs in orb shaped fixtures that illuminate a warm gorgeous glow everywhere. Adjacent to the bar is a very cool rustic style wooden facade mounted above their open kitchen. In it are holes and in the holes are full bottles of beautifully backlit rose wine, which is again very appealing to the eyes and the stomach. The bar has two "sides", inside and out, allowing for a very inviting and open, social atmosphere. When the outside portion is open you can view out to the covered patio which is well shaded during the day, and well lit at night (also has overhead warming vents for the colder months). Their happy hour is too good to be True, boasting 1/2 price bottles of wine, $5 any pizza and $1 off brews, including "combo" specials of Pizza&Bottle or Greens&Bottle from $30-$50. A seriously fantastic establishment that I cannot wait to visit again.

ScbDZbktBgFPebkCnz7r4g.text: I really wanted to like this place.... I've passed by it a couple times since I live in the area so I suggested my friend and I check it out for dinner. The atmosphere is very romantic and modern. I ordered a chicken salad and thought it was a bit pricey and the chicken was very salty. I understand that everything is farm to table and house made but the area it's in... I think prices should be a little better. Not sure if I'll go back but it was good trying something new.

jhuN4icfuDYK8IhjVX0JFQ.text: Love this new spot in the somewhat up and coming area of Scottsdale/Arcadia. We needed something here! Service is great. My experience of the food has been good. I will say hat the main courses are always very delicious. I haven't been a fan of the sides however and wish they had some more "normal" side options. Very much like the reasonable prices as well.

iM2iF5qAHGCSvMCW6J24CQ.text: First time visiting we were recommended the meatballs as a starter and The Mia pizza, both were delicious. They created a great atmosphere at this location. I feel like we had the best table in the place, the first table outside on the patio with the doors open and a gentle AC breeze coming from inside. Good drink selection. Some good Nebraska hospitality including frying up a couple eggs for our pizza even after we had eaten a couple slices.

pbi4cgASuBox8DaAFNn-gg.text: Foodies beware....The star is for our server and the 80s music/bar atmosphere.  The food doesn't deserve any stars.  We ordered gnocchi, onion rings and an olive bowl for appetizers.  The olive bowl was ok-I mean they opened a jar and served them up-which in hind sight was preferable to having the kitchen "prepare" your food but this CA girl expects exceptional chef marinated home cured olives if they're actually served as an separate appetizer and not part of a cheese/charcuterie board.  The focaccia bread on top of bowl was ok. The gnocchi dough was made properly but cut into uneven pieces and then completely ruined by a saute of way too much balsamic vinegar.  Half of them were crunchy.  The other half soft. The plate had a bed of marinara with giant chunks of canned tomatoes-no one chopped properly or with even knife cuts.  And the marinara was only on half of the plate. This dish had peas in the mix?  Just look at pix.  Looked as bad as it tasted.  The onion rings were bland and over cooked.  We also ordered their specialty pizza.  We went for a simple margherita.  See pic.  Wow and I don't mean that in a good way  They threw whole canned tomatoes on top. The crust tasted only of charcoal in the spots which were charred otherwise bland and unseasoned.  After we were served I decided there was no head chef and no quality control whatsoever in this place.  This bar is  masquerading as a gastropub.

JHbchRKZ4Qy7yOF1-pE3ww.text: Yum!  I came here Sunday for a girl's lunch.  The patio is amazing!  Easy parking.  It was a bit too windy to sit outside but highly recommend.  We dined inside at a hightop and they had the garage doors open.  Perfect day! Service was fantastic and food spot on!  Perfect spot for happy hour or to hang out with friends.  Check it out!

znb3C0NRdt54llTkqLbOAQ.text: This is a fantastic concept- carefully thought out menu and great wine list bryan was very knowlagable on the extensive wine list   Our server was also very helpful accommodating our many dietary restrictions at our table

Sy1ZGR684sZmm5RBkquylg.text: This was one of our new favorite spots & have been there 3 times in the last 30 days. However today was a series of unfortunate events.  Ordered the same build your own pizza ($20- these are not cheap pizzas)I had ordered before however this time it had about 1/3 of the toppings it had before. We ordered 1/2 of that pizza to have no cheese and the other half light cheese. The cheese side had more cheese, about double the amount of any pizza we've had there before. But we didn't want to bring it up to the server b/c my daughter also ordered spaghetti & meatballs however, no one at the table wanted it because of the taste and we LOVE spaghetti & meatballs, but this was dark red sauce with a layer of grease all over the top of it. My daughter only will eat red meat in a hamburger or meatballs & she LOVES meatballs, but she took one bite and couldn't eat it. We told the waitress there's no way she can eat this, she doesn't usually eat meat except meatballs but she does not like this meal at all.   The server took it away but still charged us for it.   No, you're not required to replace it. But, that shows me you don't care about us returning to your location. Ok, we heard ya, loud and clear!   Try BASE PIZZA it's absolutely delicious and you can watch people night hiking from the restaurant.

Ev_7S63GicvXwpIs6v8AhQ.text: Scottsdale? Yeah, not my temperature, I was visiting a friend in the area and hungry. A cursory glance made me think - "meh, another try-hard but likely mediocre gastropub, dime a dozen these days..." Was I ever wrong.  First I should preface that if you look at the reviews for this place they're mostly good, but the smattering of sour ones seem to have small problems with service or are made by alcoholics who want long-pouring bartenders. I found lunch service attentive and professional, but I don't drink. Now...if you're looking for quality Italian food - look no further. Wow. Ingredient quality A+. Plate conception A-. Execution A+. San Marzano tomatoes? Check? Perfectly al-dente semolina spaghetti longer than your arm? Check. Tender veal meatballs? Check. Perfectly prepared sauce with the right touch of garlic and pasta water. Check. Appetizers, soups, and salads are all very well conceived with an original touch. Major props to the *real* chefs in the kitchen and to the managers for ordering top quality ingredients.  Pitch is hot and heads above so many sad Italian restaurants I've been to throughout the US over many years. Maybe the heat in Scottsdale isn't so bad after all.

Vk9KGu4R_ws1jmfq8uoeNA.text: I came here with family Sunday afternoon. The pizza was awesome! The crust is crispy and the sausage was obviously house-made. We also tried the bolognese fries were also super unique and delicious. The sauce was fresh and the truffle oil was a nice addition. The tires are thin and crispy which I love!  The kids menu items are expensive but again, the food was very fresh. My only "issue" might be with the kids Mac & cheese. It comes out in a piping hot skillet- which for a child is an issue. The flavor is also VERY smoky. The adults loved it but I could see how a child would prefer something more traditional, and again, not served in a skillet (that's a recipe for a disaster)!   I did not get a drink but they had lots of exciting craft cocktails I would love to go back and try. They had a plethora of mules that were different. I'll definitely be back!

v827yheYPhobEm-25X2gQg.text: I love this place! Great beer selection, and awesome pizza. If it's not too hot they have a very large outside area that's super cute. Today we got the meatball appetizer which was a really decent size and super reasonable on their happy hour and also comes with some focaccia bread! The shrooms pizza is delicious but typically we do the "pitch your own" and get their house made sausage which is SOOO good. Definitely check this place out.

74BH1RrhgWV_OWWY2YOjGw.text: Now this was a surprise to me, the area was formally business suites and doctor offices.  They have transformed it to a different place with an open atmosphere to catch your eye and attention.  Don't blink or you'll miss it just before 60th St on Thomas Road Northside.  Pitch has an array of menu items that the cooks in the back have created and awesome dinning experience.  Let me start with the Smoked Peach BBQ Wings (yes you read it) creatively constructed and paired great (only other place that had them better was in Atlanta,  GA) flavor and the presentation with the iceberg wedge with a creamy blue cheese dressing was on point.  Then it was the Coal-Fired longsteam artichokes dish, prepared nicely and man this is worth traveling here to get.  Keep it up PITCH this is the new spot to get your creative grub on!!!

yAqW3S_3bwiFbpy9tmfbUQ.text: Favorite go-to spot for delicious pizza and brisket sliders. Always order the margarita pizza and add the mushroom medley on top. ViIDZ3kzbItIOhZ8hK7SSw.text: Thankful we had reservations as pitch was packed  Food arrived piping hot and delicious the burger was great salad was yum my martini cold and tasted Amazing the cheddar Mac and cheese bubbling and browned very tasty good beer selection oh the French fries super skinny crunchy and hot fresh accompanied by some delicious ranch dressing very happy we decided on pitch I feel the value for the money was well worth it

-BUK7wz-lPfBGJKSBfy3Sg.text: Pitch has a lot of seating indoor and outdoor. It's a great place to come watch the sunset. We sat at the bar and ordered drinks then food. The chicken pesto pizza was amazing. So was the service. Everyone was genuinely nice and helpful. We also had salads and wine.

Cc7f9d4XhsT5dyQaJ6ygkw.text: After a visit to the DBG we found this place just up the street. It has a really cute set up, with a sleek and modern interior as well as an open patio and bar. Two of us were able to snag a table on the patio around 7:30pm on a Saturday night without a wait, so that was awesome!  They have an extensive wine list as well as many cocktail and beer options. Shortly after being seated we were brought water but then had to wait awhile for our server to greet us. It seemed like she had the entire patio so it was kind of understandable it took a bit. Once she did make it to our table she was really nice and filled us in on specials for the evening.   Considering they highlight their pizzas, we both wanted to try one. My girlfriend just got a plain cheese ($12) and I went with the short rib pizza, which was their pizza of the week ($25). While we were waiting for our food, it started to sprinkle on the patio. The staff was fairly quick in getting the umbrellas up and making sure each table was as covered as possible. Props to them there! Although if it had started pouring I'm not sure that we could have stayed dry. Luckily it didn't!  Another thing to note was that my girlfriend got a Diet Coke and they bring you a can and glass of ice.   Once our food came out we were excited to dig in. The pizzas are a large size and definitely big enough to share. We probably should have just split one but it was nice to try two different kinds. We ended up leaving with a full pizza (half of each) on our way out for lunch the next day.   The short rib pizza wasn't bad. It came with carrots, cheese and some type of sauce on top. It was a nice try for a speciality pizza but it didn't stand out as memorable for me. It was good but I wouldn't order it again. Especially for the price, I'm not sure that it really delivered. The cheese pizza was pretty basic (yes we know it's just cheese) but neither of us were big fans of the sauce. Again, it was decent but we probably wouldn't order it again.   Overall, it's a really nice space with friendly service, we just didn't walk away thinking anything special about the food. They do have many pizza variations, as well as pastas, burger options, as well as some main dishes and appetizers. Definitely seems like a good place to have drinks and share some munchies.

Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hV7SXuOY88TgMBG8rPdMnA.text: Great list of reasonable priced alcohol and lots of menus to choose from:  They offer Breakfast M-F. Brunch Saturday and Sunday. Lunch everyday. Happy Hour M-F 2pm-6pm (food and drink specials)  Dinner everyday.  a Whiskey Menu.   They have gluten free pizza and sandwich bread.  But nothing on the menu is indicated as such. If you have an allergy ask lots of question.   We ordered the COAL-FIRED LONG STEM ARTICHOKES Flatbread with house-made hummus, cherry tomatoes, parmesan, baby green salad, sweet onion vinaigrette, lemon garlic aioli.  Our bartender was able to make it gluten free by omitting the flat bread portion, which he described as more of a chip than a flat bread.  In any case he gave us some cucumbers to accompany the dish.  The dish ended looking more like a salad, with loads of shredded cheese. It was tasty as well as the Lemon Aioli, but too much cheese for my preference.  (I know, who says such a thing?) $12  We also ordered the CAJUN CAESAR SALAD with Avocado anchovy dressing, romaine, house-made croutons, cherry tomatoes, parmesan. Choice of chicken, shrimp or salmon, we opted for the Chicken, $16 (see picture)   Because of my gluten allergy, we ordered our salad without croutons.  The chicken was great, grilled to perfection, could have used a few more slices, considering the price.  However, the salad was also over loaded with shredded cheese, it really took away from the salad itself.  In my opinion, the dressing was watery, and not very flavorful, had a fishy hint to it.  I understand Cesar dressings is made from anchovies, guess what I'm trying to say is, it didn't compliment the salad.   This is a great place for large group gatherings, they have a separate private room that can hold 100+ people. Pretty awesome to have that available. Great gathering place for after work drinks and Birthday parties.   Will be back to try 2 of 7 menus.

o6OrBKVJ0VVEvYC7v0YvNg.text: Great place in Scottsdale for pizza. We came here for lunch this past weekend. There was an event going on but the service was still pretty quick.  We ordered the shrooms pizza with fried eggs added. We also ordered a custom pizza with roasted chicken, prosciutto, mushrooms, and caramelized onions.   Both of the pizza were delicious. The toppings portions were very generous. The shrooms pizza was deliciously creamy.  My favorite was the custom pizza however. I love prosciutto and I especially appreciated the option of being able to add the prosciutto after the pizza has been cooked to prevent it from being too hot and melty   We enjoyed our lunch here and would definitely want to come back. I recommend checking this place out if you're craving pizza!

Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Custom pizza with roasted chicken, prosciutto, mushrooms, and caramelized onions

Dp5Dzpdq6XWAQrYVzBO_aA.text: Omaha Nebraska native is what I am...desert rat is what I have become.  So happy to have this gem here in AZ to remind me of home.  Originally based in a great area of Omaha called Dundee.  So excited that I can continue to enjoy the fantastic atmosphere, food and libations that the creators of Pitch do so well!    Beer and wine tastings were solid and the food was fantastic.  Charcuterie board of meat and cheese was shared and loved among the table.  Meatball appetizer was outstanding.  Thai pizza was ok.  Roasted beet salad and baby spinach mushroom salad delicious.    Can't wait to go again.  And again.  And again

mUossQmeduIhN_Ogv6vu_Q.text: NomNomz: 5/5 Libations: 5/5 Service: 5/5 Ambiance: Trendy, casual, fun! Price Range $$  If you love yourself some ZA (pshhh who doesn't) then this is a must-try spot in Scottsdale! Everything made from scratch?! Sign me up.  Nomz: The pizza here is fan-freakin-tastic. Can't go wrong with their "Dos or Tres Peps" (if you're a spicy fan, add jalapenos to that - SO good). Their "Shrooms" is also heavenly. If you're a mushroom fan, the truffle oil and parsley combination will knock your socks off. Their pizzas are loaded with flavor, and the crust is so effing good. With a perfect crisp, you won't be able to put it down. For realz. All the pizzas range from $14-$21, really decent prices for the fresh products you're getting.   I only really came for the pizza, but the rest of their menu looked phenomenal. There's truly too many dishes to choose from, so I'd recommend grabbing a group of friends and sharing all the goods! Don't forget to try their appetizers! The coal-fired long stem artichoke salad is unreal. It's a really large portion though, you can definitely share it with multiple people. I saw a few others and they all looked amazing.  Libations: They've got a full bar, and great cocktails to choose from. A pretty large beer selection (+ some local drafts), along with some great wine selections. All normal prices. They also offer a number of unique Moscow Mules which is pretty impressive.  Happy Hour! I'll have to come back for this. Mon-Fri 2-6 PM. $1 off beers, 1/2 price bottles of wine (score!), and $5 off pizzas. Doesn't get much better than that.   Tip: They offer a multi-course private chef experience with food and wine pairings, sounds fun for a special occasion if you're looking for something unique.  Overall experience: Holy smokes, dat was goooood. And their service was amazing. We had multiple people drop by our table to make sure we had everything we needed. Very pleasant energy there! Will definitely be returning to check out the rest of their menu!

y_9Zm-AbS1Mi3zkWEZd4-g.text: Pitch has a casual, relaxed feel to it.  The interior is spacious and contemporary; they also have a large outdoor patio.   Despite a few hiccups in the food and service, we enjoyed our dinner.      Service was a little spotty with a forgotten drink order, and water glasses that did not get refilled. As for the food, we shared the onion rings (half order - crispy, hot), the Thai Pie  (ok),  and the Artichoke Flatbread (not really what I was expecting but tasty).   For the main course, I ordered the duck entree, cooked 'medium' as recommended by our server, but it was served rare.  I sent it back and the second time around it was very good.       I look forward to sitting outside next time and trying other items from the menu.

5WaZqu8fKOZ5rZbRg16c0Q.text: First time visitor. The food was very good and the service was pretty good. Server in training. The place was somewhat empty maybe because of the football game and Sunday brunch timeframe. Overall I believe the place will do well overtime. Hope to visit again!

2IepEu8EhqdlRAMJ9Z_Ceg.text: Nothing to write home about. Not worth the price tag in my opinion. Food was mediocre at best. Atmosphere was cool but the food wasn't. I don't expect this place to stay open long with the cure t menu.

KJDajVk3Mx1s4Yp2VlEu1w.text: The food was GREAT.  Artichoke with long stems that had been marinated.  Meatballs the best. Pizza was excellent.  The facility is excellent.  Acoustics gentle. Lighting superb.  Great patio. Plenty of space between tables.   Loved it. Congrats Dean! Larry

5BvCsXSCtmyIZSUOmbOf9w.text: The Pitch offers a fresh new menu to Phoenix. The meatball appetizer and artichoke appetizer are yummy. The patio is cozy and offers views of Papago mountain. Happy hour is a great deal so be sure to show before 6pm. Cheers!

TXGe0J4ubzXIFrxlpSx0QQ.text: We have had many amazing dishes. If you like artichokes I recommend the appetizer but be prepared it is not served like you will expect-it's more a salad but the chokes are amazing and the dish is fantastic! The parpadelle is amazing so is mushroom pizza! The only reason they dont get 5 stars is because we have been many times now since they opened and they still cannot figure out how to time their meals to hit the table at once. We've been 10+ and it has happened 100% of the time. Be prepared for your meals to come it separately. Otherwise Pitch is one of our favorites!

EJ2XTPVLTb8bo2WkDHw3dQ.text: My boyfriend and I tried this place for the first time today and we were very pleased! Hannah was such a sweet young lady and took wonderful care of us. The sweet and spicy chicken wings were delicious and the MIA pizza was just yummy! We both got cocktails and those were tasty yes Powerful (reminded me of San Diego cocktails) We will definitely be back to try different items on the menu! Thanks Hannah!!

wBOQ71cjsKllw5yELDI9JQ.text: My mom & I decided to try Pitch for our first night in Scottsdale since my mom loved the Pitch in Omaha. We wanted to try a bunch of different things & ended up ordering two happy hour dishes & two starters; Angus beef sliders, Bolgonese Fries, Basil Gnocchi & Brussel Sprouts. The sliders were our least favorite of the dishes. We both agreed there wasn't enough meat or cheese plus the reduced balsamic drizzled on the top of the bun made our hands sticky & was hard to get off. The Brussel Sprouts were the 2nd to least favorite. The flavor was delicious, but the sprouts were unfortunately soggy & not at all roasted & crispy. The Basil Gnocchi also was delicious. I wasn't big on the gnocchi being infused, the pesto flavoring was drowned out by the red sauce as it sat surrounded by peas. The Bolognese Fries with truffle oil were the winning dish. The fries were so thin & crispy they were addictive. For sure some of the best fries I've had in Scottsdale yet. The sauce and ricotta on top paired perfectly with the truffle oil. Can't wait to come back to Pitch & try one of their pizzas or pasta that are supposed to be pretty good. Definitely coming back, however, for those fries.

a5NYOGkWJjfkgFPtdpJvNg.text: We absolutely loved our experience at Pitch. We have been a couple of times for dinner at this location and the restaurant has great energy and even greater food to back it up! We tried the weekend brunch today for the first time.  We started off with a fresh squeezed orange juice and an excellent latte. The coffee flavor was very scrumptious.  Then we moved on to the entrees and we had the Short Ribs Enchilada and the Creme Brulee Stuffed French Toast...nothing short of amazing! The flavor profiles of both were off the charts. 1lh0Lyy6InDBfsGmkBGEIA.text: An excellent restaurant within walking distance, and I'm ever so thankful! We've been 2x in the past week and were not disappointed! If you happen to dine on the nights they offer the Cheesburger Soup, go for it! It is phenomenal!!  I love the crab cakes, both appetizer and entree. My husband had spaghetti and meatballs and portion was huge, so prepare yourself. If you like salmon, there's is great. You can get it on any of their salads or as an entree. We will be back for Sunday brunch - cheeseburger soup and 1/2 price wine bottles.

PC_LlxDfFOpLZWYhTL4lLg.text: What a great menu for the whole family! This place knows how to make some food. The Rosemary wings perfect! Buffalo chicken salad HOT but so good! Burger is amazing!

Pz4dkeCcFptwqs7vS_vyrw.text: Stopped by for dessert on Sunday and the place was fairly dead but of course it was a Sunday evening around 7pm. It is a large space with a great outdoor patio decorated urban chic with open kitchen. The staff was great very friendly and accommodating and we were impressed with great selection of tequilas and bourbons. My husband and I shared a neat Pappy Van Winkle 15 Year Reserve which was modestly priced considering the cost of a bottle which was excellent and the bartender was nice enough to have purchase a half shot of an unusual wine barrel aged tequila which was also very good. As for the dessert it was just okay. We shared the Key Lime Pie that our server raved about it but to us it was nothing to rave about and underwhelming at best. It seemed fresh and we were told it was made in-house but seemed more like it might have come from a box with a small dollop of whipped cream on top and some kind of raspberry sauce that surrounded the dish. Based on the dessert I'm not sure if it would be worth a return trip if the other menu items are just as underwhelming which is sad because it really is a nice place.

t6i7WA1ho2Tlo9Fihg38vg.text: I've been here a couple times and have always had a great meal, service and drinks! It is such a cute restaurant and never disappoints! The staff is very friendly! It's a nice place for a bike ride/weekend brunch spot! They typically have a bunch of rental bikes outside their location and parking is very convenient. Highly recommend it.

YCjeMQQMwepefBPaDXPrrQ.text: First time here and we love the food. They are known for their pizza but we weren't here for pizza. They have an extended menu that will please almost everyone. The place is beautiful with a huge patio. So today, we had the calabrese meatball salad. It sounded odd but interesting. The meatball was moist and the salad favorable. We also ordered the soup of the day, which was a tomato base bean and chorizo with veggies. Spicy but it was so good. Definitely coming back to try other items on the menu.

MWqbOO4NSLZ1IN9bCiEgNg.text: The pappardelle was amazing... sat at the bar with friends and the bartenders were hilarious... cheese cake was great and if you like whiskey/scotch/bourbon... great selection and also a really good mix of tequila. New favorite spot near Arcadia.. really nice patio too!!

cxfxF1gMsPTMCIre-ID72w.text: Been here a few times in the past month with nothing but good things to say! Meatballs are incredibly tender, pizza is off the hook (probably the highlight), along with modern/hip restaurant and patio. The staff is friendly and management seems to always be active in the dining room. Could be the next neighborhood gem!

wzDjr93nUdyaOon6sRKTCQ.text: Vegetarian love! We ordered the Margherita pizza and added avocado, pesto & peperoncinis...  wow! Amazing! Atmosphere is absolutely beautiful. Our waitress was very friendly. All the staff was also very welcoming. Definitely coming here often.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WEyyGvAMLKnv5iq6etjglA.text: The bartender is hot.... I hope she calls me. Also apparently I am supposed to write more because it was not enough to post...

4G8LVxTW1wqasqg_Pwu6FQ.text: Awesome atmosphere, really cool Neighborhood vibe and would be a great hotspot if I lived in the area.  Great Happy hour, Best Meatballs in town, loved the Pizza and everyone raved on the specials! Staff was fun and very knowledgeable.  Cool spot that cant wait to get back to!

SfgsfrrLvkZj_8dt5HVl7A.text: I've driven by hundreds of times. Stopped in for some lunch. Cool looking place. I sat at the bar. Grabbed a cold beer it was good. I was given a menu read the menu finished my beer. Checked Facebook my email and other things was finally offered another beer. Didn't get a chance to order food I had to leave. If you're a party of one you seem to get looked over. I will try again as it's close to my house. P

ViSJ8ws3LIDjq4bZG8o0LA.text: Very disappointing. We've been looking forward to trying out this new place for quite a while. We tried appetizers where the artichoke dip was salty and the chicken wings were dry and tasteless. Three of us also had pasta dishes which were also very bland. For the four of us the bill was $156. For that kind of money my food should be delicious! I agree that the vibe is good and it was much needed in that area of town but the food really needs to step up its game.

YFE4riBFUQyDTF1q_jdQAA.text: Our server, Lucas was great and extremely knowledgeable about the menu items. The atmosphere is inviting with seating in door as well as out door and it is conveniently located in the heart of a neighborhood, I will definitely be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Roasted beets, mixed greens, roasted butternut squash, pistachio, baked goat cheese filo and red wine vinaigrette.

wrEUfg7xjLDYtQoOAVtLFA.text: We had a Mia pizza and a marsala pizza with a thai salad appetizer. The food was delicious. My only complaint- the berry cobbler takes a while, if they had told us we could have ordered it earlier. It is definitely worth the wait but if we could've avoided the wait- even better. The COO, manager(?), Dean was above and beyond kind and competent. You learn from the top; judging by Dean they are in very good hands,

1yknvOlzx3dzkk5Y0oYAzw.text: What an amazing place. So glad this place opened so close to me. It's def a must try place! Even came back in the morning to try breakfast. If you haven't been please do!   They're a little hidden.... in the Business complex that's been there forever that's been giving an amazing face lift  Just west of 64th street on the north side of Thomas   Your Welcome in advance

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tomahawk Porkchop

6M79A11RdL4Ozab1TMgitw.text: One of my all time favorite restaurants and my go-to place   Great food, great staff. Happy hour on the patio is always fun. Dog friendly, so bring the pouch

MQWewV4tmc3f0ztoC8vQkA.text: Really nice indoor-outdoor atmosphere. I think this new restaurant will do well, especially considering that most tables there were ordering multiple drinks before noon on a Saturday.  Servers were pleasant. Lots of them standing around, waiting for more business.  My husband's cheeseburger had excellent flavor with a fresh bun. His shoestring fries were good and plentiful. I would not re-order the corned beef hash. Too many large-chunk potatoes and not enough other flavors. The meat in it was ok.  They could use some fly control. Big open garage doors allowed many flies in.  Will be back to try other items.

8GfTaXuqL7wme1-mi0HN6A.text: Our server was fantastic, but the food was eh.  Calamari, more breading (like fried chicken breading) and pepperoncinis than calamari, the sauce was tasty though.  "Tiger shrimp" tagliatelle, the shrimp were tiny, not tiger shrimp at all, and the sauce was more creamy than and lemon garlicky as described, though the noodles were delicious.  Filet I understand was delicious as were the scalloped potatoes.  Crab cake appetizer not good, as the salad thing under it had bean sprouts and beans and who knows what else, very weird.  The crab cake itself lacked flavor.  Cool ambience but only like five beers on tap?  Rest in bottles.  Needs some tightening on the food and draft beer for sure.

0nktof1wEdw8VShye4rcXw.text: Scampi Taglatorri for the win!  I got this the first time and every time. It is like handmade pasta with shrimp and fresh veggies. So good, I crave it. Nice open atmosphere and staff is consistently on par. Tonight Perry was our server and did an outstanding job of being engaging without being overbearing. Nice to talk to and knowledgeable about the menu while offering helpful suggestions. I'll be back again and again.  Only four stars as it is a little expensive for what you get and service is consistently slow, but I will be back.

4vdQmS7YDvuuS1TeSaab9w.text: My new favorite place! Its even dog friendly. Everything from the beer to the food is a winner. The calamari, meatballs, pizza and burgers are amazing but if you can only get one thing for some reason I say get the Buffalo cauliflower!

BpXOpsE8MgfXYMZJ6QgInQ.text: The good: Tasty cocktails, beautiful outdoor atmosphere. The pizza is ok. Crust is tasty, and there's a good ratio of ingredients. The sausage is DELICIOUS.   The bad: Everything is pricier than I think is merited. $21 pizza is kind of insane in this area. The place is across from a Fry's parking lot. I mean, it's pizza. $3 a topping? Come on. I also didn't like their misleading menu. The happy hour menu says "$5 off any pizza." We ordered a create-your-own pizza and didn't get the discount. I asked why and was told that the create-your-own isn't included in the Happy Hour deal. I'm not going to fight about $5, but that was misleading and disappointing and illogical. When I suggested they change the wording of "any pizza" they responded "we're not changing our menu, we've never gotten any complaints." I thought the attitude was dismissive and kind of embarrassing. I'm a customer giving you a (rational) suggestion. Even if you're not going to change it, at least acknowledge that you can see where it might be confusing, and approach it with a less smarmy attitude. They did give us a $10 gift card, which I appreciate, but I will not be back, even though I live across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Says &#34;any pizza&#34; is $5 off for happy hour but this apparently does not include the create-your-own. Ridiculous, head&#39;s up for everyone else!

ScuOPOqKhn6_2PiAHywsHQ.text: My sister found out that the "chop salad " is not actually chopped, it's just called that (quoting a young manager). Then I found apple slices on my pizza of which none were uniform. The pizza crust was soggy at the middle corner by the third slice :( the fig flavor was good
