S1PxpfXb5N-lNxUOowcQWg.text: Not sure what sucked worse the food or the service...........both were horrible!

sXUi7L1BlLnySffrEanl4w.text: Great ambiance! Patio is very welcoming. Lengthy menu was surprising and filled with many delectable dishes. Let's not forget about the drink menu, wines and cocktails are all fantastic! Definitely recommend; we ate here and enjoyed ZooLights afterwards, great night!

i1PeJZyhUk7CGzjnUalNqA.text: Went to Pitch tonight for an early dinner.  Great atmosphere and food.  Husband had their Margarita pizza and loved it.  Got it with a bottle of their house Chardonnay for a great price and taste.  Their Crab Cake Salad was delicious with two large crab cakes that were perfectly baked with just the right amount of crispness.  Will definitely be going back to try other items on their extensive menu.

R8P46B_LoLEd6_Eq15_cQQ.text: Six of us decided to try this relatively new restaurant, and it was definitely a winner. Really great pizza and appetizers, especially the calamari and meatballs in  sauce, and wonderful woodfired pizzas. The service was very friendly and prompt, and the owner came over and was very excited and enthusiastic about the restaurant. It's a really fun space with indoor and outdoor seating, dog friendly, and has a wonderful wine list and over 100 scotches. One to check out!

qkqsP0poJDPwm58yPYSkVw.text: We picked this place based on the reviews and it did not disappoint. Service was good. Not over the top friendliest but friendly enough and efficient. I never would have ordered the artichoke starter if I hadn't of read the reviews... but wow. Just do it. Incredibly impressed with it. We got and shared a pizza and the meatball salad and not a single thing disappointed. The house (cheapest) red wine was also fantastic with our lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pXWpDnexsuE41xlEVkb3Zg.text: Just amazing!  Fresh veggies, pizza was delicious and quickly devoured, most of all the service was superb!

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sorry,  no pictures of the delicious food. Highly recommend this place, salads and pizzas were fresh and delicious, back for sure!

lw0Il5_47gzYtevaq6r-SQ.text: Great food! Excellent service! Beer tap choices limited, but good. Also bottled beer options. Excellent wine list and nice cocktails. I highly recommend for groups.

z47qZFgjoOynhCH24n6XsA.text: Took 12 to Pitch tonight.  Excited after getting take out.  Thought we'd go back with friends.  We had a great table on the patio.  Waters came out right away.  We were missing one chair.  Reminded our server.  The rest of our party arrived and still no chair.  Our reservation was booked days in advance. We got appetizers, then ordered entrees.  We needed kids menus and they needed to make copies. My husband requested more water.  Our server never came back.  I went to remind him about the menus and water.  Our entries began arriving.  All our appetizer plates were still cluttering the table, and still no water refills. I went to find out server to ask if they could clear our table and refill waters.  He got a big attitude.  A girl came to clear.  We were assisting her by handing her plates.  Most meals arrived except two.  Eventually my nephews salad arrived.  My sons burger arrived after I asked the estimate?  The kitchen had made an error on it.  By the time it arrived the entire table was done.  He had snacked on appetizers and half my husbands pasta.  I let the waiter know he just could not eat it as it came so late.  He responded with " oh I'll wrap it up for home!"  Honestly they should've removed it from the bill.  I'm very disappointed in the service.  Good food, good atmosphere, poor

dhlh5zBvvi_y3FcHznfl9Q.text: So I'm from Austin TX (food snob capital of America).  This place is so good I'm leaving a review even before the entree's come out. Place is hip, staff is friendly. The calamari excellent. Have no doubt the pizza and Thai salad are gonna be delish.  Update:  The Bianco Verde pizza was simply amazing, and the Thai salad delivered the goods.

gKilqtrhKKa_996PUbz1pA.text: Service was great - all staff smiled and attentive! Atmosphere is trendy with great space for indoors and nice outside patio. Perfect for this weather! I like that it's not located in the MESS of Scottsdale traffic. Makes going there more pleasant. Kids shared cheese pizza, & hubby and I shared The Doc. We also shared a mushroom salad. The food was tasty.  If you prefer your pizza dough to be toasty/crunchy throughout your slice, then this place is it! I'm not a fan of soggy pizza. Even with all our toppings, it held up. The flavor/seasoning is well balanced and light.  The salad was yummy and not dripping in dressing, the vinaigrette dressing taste was subtle and paired well with the pistachios, spinach & cheese... Standard drinks are served by the can which is cool, until you want a refill or 2, $. But I like the can idea! because it's way cleaner than the soda dispensers, bacteria builds up quick if it's not cleaned regularly. Overall, pretty darn good. We'll most likely try a white pizza our next go-round!

G-JB6IF1Xjqxj_VYgcSemA.text: Food's ok. The owner is a complete ass who can't take a joke and doesn't know how to deescalate. I literally had to tell him he I did not wish to talk to him after he kept insisting over and over that my passing on a message that my boss requested Happy Hour pricing despite wanting to eat at the office, was a lack of respect. I was simply asking because she asked me to, meanwhile he kept calling me the wrong name and saying I am disrespectful. I left the kind bartender a 20% tip and got tf out of there. What a d**khead.

VJo1WIrBAPFmE46NjhggDw.text: Just sitting on this delight of a patio makes for a great meal. That the food is also downright good makes things close to perfect. I especially love that this place offers a few unexpected items such as white anchovies and peppadew. So why not five stars? For me it was poor dishwashing and for my wife slowness of service. Oh, special mention to the general friendliness of the clientele and the many cool dogs that get to join us humans here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. No dogs in this picture but there are often great canines at Pitch.

4rJEWZowxVLdF28pDiiQFg.text: We absolutely love this place!!!  The artichoke is the bomb!  Pizza are legit, and after coming here for months loving everything we've ordered I get the filet....wow...beyond reproach.  We love local high end steakhouses, but this filet is better!  The Gorgonzola butter is ridiculous, but the filet was cooked perfectly...little bit of char...wow.  Not sure I can order anything else moving forward!  Wow!!

79zaHS9S2GTTqEV-8VZ6oA.text: The vibe is here is breezy, especially when the weather is nice and there's a... breeze.   Unfortunately, something annoyingly dumb happened, and it will just nag at me to the point I probably won't go back.  The happy hour says ANY pizza is $5 off, but of course, this apparently doesn't apply to 'create-your-own' pizzas which they didn't mention when I ordered one. To add a level of nonsensical absurdity to the bait-and-switch, the custom pizza costs $12 with "San Marzano tomato sauce & mozzarella" before adding your ingredients. But $6 of "extra mozzarella" and "fresh mozzarella" was added for no reason, and when I brought it up, the waitress acted like this was totally normal. Like every pizza obviously needs extra and fresh cheese. Because the mozzarella it comes with would never be enough. So apparently everyone who orders a 'create-your-own' pizza gets a mystery charge for mystery cheese. Sure.  So I spent almost $40 on one little pizza and a drink. During happy hour. No thank you.

4W3THozRnwvrE0UDJk1j1g.text: So excited to find such a great restaurant. Service was outstanding. Our server was attentive, friendly, and helpful. Our group of four shared the onion rings, which we all really enjoyed. My husband and I shared the meatball pizza; it was delicious. The meatballs were melt in your mouth good. Also really enjoyed the seasonal berry cobbler. Will definitely be back as all the food coming from the kitchen looked amazing.

pnX22DtvpPw_oJXKk94Y1g.text: Best Pizza in Scottsdale and possibly Arizona all together. Very cool and relaxing vibe. The service is great, bartenders are cool, and the owner has come out to greet my boyfriend and I twice. Try an egg on your pizza you won't be sorry!

qI07aHUoOEYrq1KGRBSGOA.text: I always feel like I am on vacation here! Love the food and the drinks! The patio is outstanding but slowly going downhill like other hot spots in town due to the dogs. The couches are ruined and those areas are a little dirty.

zCGKkha1-B_XPmXBME7Slw.text: Love this place, so close to my home. The food, drinks and staff are great.  So many salads to choose from, when you're trying to eat (relatively) healthy and great sandwiches & pizza when you're not. The shoestring fries are awesome.  Also love that there is jenga and baggo (cornhole) right across the way.  One think I wish was different.... the fire 'display' would be great if they were at the couch/lounge areas, as functional fire pits.  For great drinks, see Stone and Josh.

5w_mKfBZmRBjo7SVaCLCNQ.text: I love it when a new business opens near me in an area that has been revitalized.   This restaurant is sitting in the middle of an updated business complex.  I love the look of the restaurant - open, airy with lots of patio space, which is perfect for this time of year.  I'm a bit worried about them for summer because that's a west-facing patio and windows - that's gonna get hot!    First - our server was awesome.  We sat on the patio for lunch, and it was beautiful.  People were playing corn-hole on the green area.  The menu has a great selection with some really interesting options.  Two of us ended up ordering the short-rib grilled cheese and picked greens as our side.  The others ordered the shrimp po-boy and the long-stemmed artichoke salad.  I was really intrigued by the mac-and-cheese - it is filled with good for you veggies (spinach, mushrooms, etc.) and you can add chicken or shrimp.  Next time!   Wow - we all loved the food.  The grilled cheese had LOTS of short-rib. As a matter of fact, I would recommend asking for a little sauce on the side because it was just a tad dry.  But filling!  I liked the dressing for the salad - it had a bit of ginger and was yummy.    Those grilled long-stem artichokes looked fabulous (and my friend said they were) - I see these are also available as a starter, and I plan to try those soon.  The shrimp po-boy had buffalo sauce, and my friend said that it was a bit much - be sure to recommend SOS (sauce on the side).   I plan to meet other friends there this evening for Happy Hour - I can see this becoming a favorite rendezvous - at least until summer.

lDJ6-zZGahelhyqVrDHAVg.text: Hands down one of the best customer service experiences I have had in a while. Had some family in town to visit and had a large table reserved in advance. Taylor was our server and she was fantastic. Very engaging and always coming by to check if we needed anything even though it was a busy Friday night. We will be back!

5sSd2Eb9_CSKGLiWDweOfg.text: Was so excited to see a Pitch is Scottsdale. We are from Omaha, where the other 2 locations are. Love the Brussels sprouts, meatballs and margarita pizza!

RbptP83O2O0Ziwp5yHh9Jg.text: Went here for dinner with my husband and mother in law on Thursday.  Nice place and food was pretty good.  It is rather pricey and since it is a coal cooking place there is that burnt smell in the air. I did not enjoy the smoky smell but overall it was a decent place. Server was very nice as well.

eNmCEr-d0t2UwuIxPAGdOw.text: Great food awesome beers. Excellent service too. There breakfast sandwiches are sooooo good

BjcjnPFJZU50GWkMuwKjHg.text: Great atmosphere, service, drinks and food!! The all man brothers is like an elevated alcoholic Arnold Palmer- very refreshing! For brunch we got the morning Mia- their breakfast pizza- it was good, very rich with the hollandaise, potato, and multiple meats.i would def go again especially when it cools down- the patio looks fun for fall!

Am8K3MI3Gap0Cm460Vf5Iw.text: We dined here for the first time, and YUM! They have flavored iced teas, my boyfriend got the jasmine blackberry and I had the earl grey (my favorite kind of tea) and they were very refreshing! Everything on their menu sounded delicious, but we came here for the pizza and decided on the Margarita pizza with an added balsamic drizzle. The pizza crust was airy and crispy, there was the perfect amount of cheese and the sauce was very "grandmas secret recipe " tasting- SO GOOD. For dessert we had the seasonal berry cobbler with gelato on top and it came out hot and bubbly from the oven. The service was also impeccable, and overall were very impressed by this restaurant. I am so glad we found this spot and can't wait to come back for more great food!  Also - They had 1/2 off bottles of wine which we will definitely keep in mind the next time we're headed here.

UVmzuW5EfHVO9wZmXJVIlw.text: My husband and I came in for dinner tonight.  The experience was exquisite.  We sat at the bar.  The drinks were wonderful and I thought the salad I ordered for dinner was going to be a bore.  It was anything but that.  It was beautifully displayed, delicious, and fulfilling.  The bartenders were friendly and truly loved their job.  We will definitely be making the drive back.

uUgJwR4SxSX5uPmkMWWPlw.text: When we arrived we received a very friendly greeting and were given our choice of indoor or patio seat. Since with weather was delightful we chose the patio. Our server was very friendly as well. We order vanilla lattes and reviewed the menu.   This spot is biking distance so I was really excited to try it out. I was disappointed to see there was not pancake options however they had a breakfast burrito on the menu and they are my go to breakfast option. I ordered the short rib burrito and my husband got the breakfast special, biscuits and gray.  The food didn't take long to arrive. The presentation was lovely. My meal was delicious! Short rib burrito topped with scrambled eggs and a side of breakfast potatoes with chorizo sausage. It also had this tasty jalapeno cheese sauce.   My husbands meal didn't live up to the hype. His biscuit took up most of the dish, there wasn't enough gray or sausage. He was a little disappointed. However he got the other half of my meal so that made up for his order envy.

Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Vanilla latte on the patio .. starting out delightful

rCd1Mdy5nV_CMPpcYKm8pA.text: This is hands down the best pizza I've had in Arizona. The spot is kind of hard to find it is in with some office building and almost looks like one at first. The patio is really cute and the open design of the building is really nice. The crab cake salad is also extremely good but the pizza is the star of the show. They have extremely high quality ingredients and you can taste it in every bite.

DDYDIognVECMXvMkkaW5fQ.text: out hot.   I love the idea where they brought out the large empty Italian tomatoes bin and used it as a little table for the pizza to sit on. What a good idea.   Our waiter didn't seem too social or even happy to be here.   This place is cute. Love the light fixtures. The patio is nice too. Too bad it's 100 degrees out.   I will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pitch - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shroom pizza

-EYCBGFebfCFvpVK9xtcfg.text: Awesome place and boy, did Thomas need something like this. First time we went in, the owner was there and was excited to get us set up and recommend his favorite. The whole staff here is excellent.   We've been back several times now to eat there or get take out. It's always busy, but the restaurant is really well run. The staff seems to enjoy their time there. They have a great atmosphere with an indoor/outdoor bar and a few local beer selections.   Of all things we've gotten, the pappardelle pasta stands out as the best to me, but the other pastas and the pizzas we have had are all really good with one exception; the spaghetti. I wouldn't recommend the spaghetti as it's likely not what you're expecting. But, maybe it's just me as I don't like angel hair pasta.  It may seem a bit pricy at first glance, but the quality of food is their. Their pasta and sausages are made in house. Pitch is one of our new favorite spots.

njZZ7iNy2AGYG2wJCwgRXw.text: #1 OUR party of over 50 +was booked for over 2 months . It was dining then movie screening. #1 Really BAD service includes several people holding menus up to shield the glaring sun from our eyes the bald dude had to be asked SEVERAL TIMES to move the umbrella that was standing feet away. He did not move it to help us, the staff just watched as we kept holding menus to block our eyes & played musical chairs moving every few minutes to be able to see!!! Lazy. #2 staff tried to kick us all off the table after 30 minutes and we already ordered saying it was supposed to have been reserved  [ had no reserved sign & we were TOLD that table was for us and there were 2 of our party members already sitting there for a while when we sat down] so right as our food was about to come they again tried to kick us off after we just ordered, #3 another staff, I assumed the manager came & AGAIN told us that " this table was supposed to be for others but you guys can just stay here we will figure it out " oookkk,,,, WHY COME TELL US THAT ??? WE ARE A PARTY OF 50 PEOPLE eating meals .. so STUPID!!!  #4 staff came back after we had JUST STARTED EATING said we did have to move and #4 had US ALL CARRY OUR OWN FOOD plates & glasses off that table into the film room [ I personally has 3 plates of foods and a water & cocktail] which ALL ARE IN MY REFRIGERATOR UNEATEN GOOD BYE $43!!! for actually drinking my 1 cocktail!! #5 we had to sit for 30 minutes without any service in the movie room #6 sat freezing in the ICE COLD WINDY ROOM #7 some genius had the FAN on NOT A/C so it was 62CONSTANT FLOWING air blowing FREEZING US & blowing wind on us & in our faces for nearly 2 hours straight. #8 MADE US CASH OUT OUR TABS WHILE WE were TRYING to eat & made us open a new tab if we wanted to order more drinks #9 left my food on the wind blowing table for 30 minutes after I ASKED 2 DIFFERENT PEOPLE more than once FOR BOXES so my 3 plates of food sat there under WINDY dusty air vents constantly blowing air all over my food #9 forced me to get ugly and DEMAND she walk her ass over NOW to bring me a box #10 charged me +$4 to do 1/2 the nuts the dish already came with #11 served me SALTY WAY UNDERCOOKED sprouts ...   and even tho she SHOULD HAVE known our party of FIFTY the film started at 6.30 she put all of our orders in a 6pm after we strongly reminded her multiple times .. other than that it was ok ....so long and good bye FOURTY THREE DOLLARS for 1/2 an order of onion rings, a side of brussels sprouts that were BARELY COOKED and a salad and one cocktail.. ALL UNEATEN because it had dusty air vents strongly BLOWING on it for 30+ minutes . Cant bring myself to just toss it all, I'll try to cook the sprouts myself. ANNOYED  if it was not my friends documentary we were there for, my entire party would have just up & WALKED AWAY . I doubt they will respond to this but I thought I would tell how my first experience at Pitch went from start to GLORIOUS FINISH! with SO MANY flaws and givin that the big party had been pre planned for MONTHS they need to get it together! I feel that they OWE us to show us they can do a good business. ... OR CAN THEY????????
